main event: A silver round sphere, estimated to be about half the size of a basketball, was observed near railroad tracks in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania on June 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object was noted to be silver in color and approximately 1/2 the size of a basketball., The observation was classified as visual., The exact duration of the sighting was not determined., It was reported that there were no known aircraft activities in the area at the time., The intelligence officer suggested the sighting might indicate an optical illusion.
